class Pathname

Detailed Description

Iterates over segments of a pathname in reverse order.

ReverseIterator iterates over the associated pathname sequentially from the last to the first segment. A reverse iterator points to a distinct pathname segment and can be increased and dereferenced, i.e. the pathname segment the reverse iterator points to can be retrieved.

Member Function Documentation

WString Pathname::ReverseIterator::operator * (   )  const
 

Returns the segment the reverse iterator points to.

BOOLEAN Pathname::ReverseIterator::operator!= (  const ReverseIterator &  itor  )  const
 

Checks if this reverse iterator and itor point to different segments.

Pathname::ReverseIterator Pathname::ReverseIterator::operator++ (  INT   ) 
 

The postfix increment operator. Increments the reverse iterator to point to the next segment and returns a reverse iterator pointing to the segment before having been incremented.

Returns:
Reverse iterator pointing to the segment before having been incremented.

Pathname::ReverseIterator & Pathname::ReverseIterator::operator++ (   ) 
 

The prefix increment operator. Increments the reverse iterator to point to the next segment and returns a reference to itself.

Returns:
Reference to the incremented reverse iterator.

BOOLEAN Pathname::ReverseIterator::operator< (  const ReverseIterator &  itor  )  const
 

Checks if this reverse iterator points to a segment that is before the segment that itor points to.

BOOLEAN Pathname::ReverseIterator::operator== (  const ReverseIterator &  itor  )  const
 

Checks if this reverse iterator and itor point to the same segment.

BOOLEAN Pathname::ReverseIterator::operator> (  const ReverseIterator &  itor  )  const
 

Checks if this reverse iterator points to a segment that is after the segment that itor points to.
